intro: Wikstroemia phillyreifolia, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers bloom in clusters and are an important part of the local ecosystem, providing nectar for native pollinators.
